outline:

The colophon in the Derge version mentions further Dānaśīla and Śīlendrabodhi as translators.

126a2-130a3 'jam 'phags pa 'jam dpal gyis zhus pa zhes bya ba theg pa chen po'i mdo' a r+ya man 'dzu shri ri pa ri prid tsha na ma ma ha ya na su tra 'phags pa 'jam dpal gyis zhus pa zhes bya ba theg pa chen po'i mdo' // rdzogs s+ho / /rgya gar gi mkhan po prad nya par ma dang / zhu chen gyi lo tsa ba ban de ye shes sdes bsgyur cing zhus te gtan la phab pa //
Title differs slightly from Derge and other mainstream Kanjurs. Text differs considerably from Derge. The Derge version also does not provide information about agents in the colophon. Note further that the variant title is found in many Western Tibetan collections: Lg, He, Hi, X, Go, Th.

This work is also found in Hemis, Basgo, and Lang under the same Tibetan name. As an analysis of the text itself shows, it must be seen as a version of e.g. Derge 134, which also bears the same title in Sanskrit, but a different title in Tibetan.

This work by Guhyadatta is usually found in the Tanjur, e.g., D4147, rKTs-T3485. It is, however, also found in the sūtra collections of He, EM, and Lg.

This is the same work as D826 or D1103, further also He65.15, He73.02, and Lg19.3. It must be distinguished from Ng22.57 and Ng22.60, which bear the same title, but are different works.

This identification is problematic. While the title is similar, this works does not concur with D824 or D827 and D1108, with the latter two being identical, but different from D824. ###
This volume (Ng46) in gold and silver ink on mthing shog paper was documented at Namgyal Monastery in Upper Mustang in 2017. Through an analysis of its textual contents and a comparison with other collections from Dolpo it seems obvious that this is also a fragment of a sūtra collection of 30 volumes. It style is clearly different from the older sūtra collection at Namgyal, but as this particular volume (ha) is missing in the other set, it seems possible that this volume was produced to fill the gap of the other sūtra collection. In this catalogue, the volume is listed among the other manuscript volumes from Namgyal Monastery.

This volume (Ng47) was documented at Namgyal Monastery in Upper Mustang in 2017. Through an analysis of its textual contents and a comparison with other collections from Dolpo it seems obvious that this is also a fragment of a sūtra collection of 30 volumes. It clearly differs in style but also textual contents and sequence from the older sūtra collection at Namgyal. This volume features illuminations after every single text. In this catalogue, the volume is listed among the other manuscript volumes from Namgyal Monastery.

This volume (Ng48) was documented at Namgyal Monastery in Upper Mustang in 2017. It is a tog gzungs volume with written in gold and silver ink on mthing shog paper. In this catalogue, the volume is listed among the other manuscript volumes from Namgyal Monastery.

This volume (Ng52) was documented at Namgyal Monastery in Upper Mustang in 2017. The volume starts with two dkar chags, dkar chag gsal ba'i me long (4 fols.) and dkar chag dgos 'dod kun 'byung (4 fols.). According to the first dkar chag it was produced from the same people that also produced a Bka' 'gyur and also a separate 'Bum set in Phug brag. According to the second dkar chag, this is a gzungs bsdus volume compiled originally at Dge ldan phun tshogs gling nges don dga' ba'i tshal gyi chos grwa chen po commonly ascribed to Taranatha. In this catalogue, the volume is listed among the other manuscript volumes from Namgyal Monastery.
